alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 11:53AM EST until March 01 at 10:36PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 AM EST, The stream gauge at Macksburg on Duck Creek was at 13.3 feet and slowly rising. At stages between 13 and 15 feet, Broad Street starts to flood near the creek. In addition, State Route 81 at Main Street floods. Some homes on the left bank start to flood, and the campground next to gauge floods. Farther downstream, the gauge at Whipple was at 10.6 feet and slowly rising. It may get close to its bankfull stage of 12 feet this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
